intro: Hieracium dragicola, commonly known as the Dragicola hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium dragicola is often found in areas with moderate to high levels of sunlight.
